item.title: Flytipping of mattress, cut bushes, bag of rubble and bags of rubbish on entrance of alleyway in Reddy Road, 18th September
item.description:
Flytipping of mattress, cut bushes, bag of rubble and bags of rubbish on entrance of alleyway in Reddy Road - please can this be removed. Was reported 2 weeks ago and removed and cleared now more rubbish has been dumped. This is an ongoing issue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reddy Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded brown/green bins, overflowing and encouraging rubbish dumping, 18th September
item.description:
Reported several time’s previously. 3 in total. Brown rear at rear of 44 Asylum rd(on Kings Gtive) full of discarded mixed waste, open lid, full of flies/maggots. Further brown bin on corner with meeting house lane next to litter bin. Further green bin by no 80 kings grove, marked as 78….a number which doesn’t exists. Bin regular filled by unknown individuals and emptied for free. Council tax abuse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King's Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The current public bin gets full very quickly and overflows so something needs to be done.Another way would be to collect more than once a week., 18th September
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Each week since the public bin has been placed next to the bus stop in Farnaby Road outside the flats is overflowing with waste and dog poo bags which end up on the pavement and is a health and safety situation. Either move the bin away from the bus stop and outside the flats or put another public bin on the other side of the road by the bus stop.As it stands the current public bin gets full very quickly and overflows so something needs to be done.Another way would be to collect more than once a week. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? To action as soon as posdible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farnaby Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the highway near 83 Dyne Road, 18th September
item.description:
These bricks have been left in the same spot for around 3 months and have never been moved. So I can assume they have been abandoned. They are obstructing the highway so now need to be moved please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
